intro: Davilla rugosa var. kunthii, commonly known as the roughleaf stinkbush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions with tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. The plant is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
